block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bay Shore Slaid Cleaves and Guy Clark, folk. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $40. Anthony Rapp with Albinokid, rock. April 14 at 8 p.m. $40 to $50. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.
Commack Craig Schulman; Broadway standards. April 14 at 8 p.m. $35. Commack High School, Scholar Lane. (631) 262-0200.
Farmingdale RJD2 with Busdriver and Happy Chichester, hip-hop and indie rock. Thursday at 7 p.m. $18 to $20. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.
Garden City Waldorf Chamber Players; works by Bartok, Dvorak and others. April 14 at 8 p.m. $20; seniors and students, $15. Waldorf School, Bonner Hall, Cambridge Avenue. (516) 536-2911.
Great Neck Everett Greenberg; popular Jewish music. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Sterling Glen of Great Neck, 96 Cutter Mill Road. (516) 773-8730.
Lynbrook Eranga and Prianga, vocal duo. April 14 at 2 p.m. Free. Lynbrook Library, Eldert Street and Carpenter Avenue. (516) 599-8630.
Patchogue Great Caesar's Ghost, blues/jazz/rock. April 14 at 8 p.m. $19 to $29. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.
Shelter Island Biava String Quartet; works by Haydn, Brahms and Stacy Garrop. April 14 at 8 p.m. Donation. Presbyterian Church of Shelter Island, Route 114. (631) 749-1488.

Smithtown ''Voices of Spring,'' presented by the Long Island Baroque Ensemble; works by Dowland, Marenzio and others. April 14 at 8 p.m. $20; seniors, $15; students; $10. St. Andrew's Lutheran Church, 30 Brooksite Drive. (631) 724-7386.
Southold The Martha Graham Ensemble; modern dance concert. April 14 at 7:30 p.m. $30; students, $10. Southold High School, 420 Oaklawn Avenue. (631) 734-6320.

Stony Brook ''Music of the Carriage Era,'' performed by musicians from Stony Brook University. April 15 at 2 p.m. $7; seniors, $6; students, $3. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.
Stony Brook ''The Music of John Coltrane,'' presented by the Turtle Island String Quartet. April 14 at 8 p.m. $32. Staller Center for the Arts, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-2787.
Stony Brook Rod Picott and Jory Nash, singer-songwriters. April 15 at 2 p.m. $15 to $20. University Cafe, Stony Brook Union Building, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-1093.

Westbury Art Garfunkel, folk. Thursday at 8 p.m. $50 and $60. ''Jay Black's 45th Anniversary Concert.'' April 14 at 8 p.m. $46.50 and $56.50. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
THEATER
East Farmingdale ''This Is Our Youth'' by Kenneth Lonergan. Through April 22. $18 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.

Farmingdale ''Hello, Dolly!'' by Michael Stewart and Jerry Herman, presented by Plaza Theatrical Productions. April 14 at 7:30 p.m. $15. Roosevelt Hall Little Theater, 2350 Broadhollow Road, Farmingdale State College. (631) 420-2400.

Garden City ''Love Scenes,'' by David Pumo, directed by Donna Jean Fogel. Friday and April 14 at 8 p.m. $20; students, $10. Ethical Humanist Society of Long Island, 38 Old Country Road. (516) 482-5321.

Stony Brook Monteverdi's ''L'Orfeo,'' presented by the Stony Brook Opera and Stony Brook Baroque Ensemble. Friday at 8 p.m. and April 15 at 2 p.m. $20; seniors and students, $10. Staller Center for the Arts, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-2787.
COMEDY
Bay Shore ''Comedy Series'' with Carrie Karavas, Andy Vastola and Joe Bronzi. Friday at 8 p.m. $20. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.
Brookville Bill Maher, political comedian. April 14 at 8 p.m. $45 to $85. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.
Levittown Jeff Dunham, stand-up and ventriloquist. April 15 at 6:15 and 8:45 p.m. $28 plus two-drink minimum. Governor's Comedy Club, 90 Division Avenue. (516) 731-3358.
FILM

Cutchogue ''Shanghai Ghetto,'' documentary directed by Dana Janklowicz-Mann and Amir Mann; in English, German and Mandarin with English subtitles. April 14 at 7:30 p.m. Donation: $5. Cutchogue Presbyterian Church, Main Road. (631) 298-4912.

Huntington ''Excellent Cadavers,'' documentary directed by Marco Turco; in English and Italian with English subtitles. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. $12; members, $9; reservations recommended and includes reception. ''Puccini for Beginners,'' directed by Maria Maggenti, presented by the Long Island Gay and Lesbian Film Festival. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $12; members, $9; reservations recommended. Cinema Arts Center, 423 Park Avenue. (631) 423-7611.

Westhampton Beach Finest in World Cinema Series: ''The Italian,'' directed by Andrei Kravchuk; in Russian with English subtitles. Friday and April 14 at 7:30 p.m.; April 15 at 1 and 4 p.m. $3 to $10. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
OUTDOORS

Babylon ''Family Freshwater Fishing Festival,'' fishing in stocked lake, lectures, contests and refreshments; fishing license requirement suspended for festival. April 14, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. $6 per vehicle. Belmont Lake State Park, Deer Park Avenue. (631) 667-5055.

Huntington ''Just a Hike,'' adult nature hike along six-mile trail. April 8 at 9:45 a.m. ''Nature on the Move (Western Section),'' moderate adult nature hike along four-mile trail. April 15 at 10:30 a.m. Both: $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.

Oakdale ''Bird-n-Breakfast,'' birding basics and continental breakfast followed by observation walk. April 14 at 8 a.m. $3; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Stony Brook ''Herb Gardening Workshop,'' learn to plant, grow and use herbs; led by Nancy Smith, master gardener. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.
SPOKEN WORD

Bridgehampton Betsy McCully, author of ''City at the Water's Edge: A Natural History of New York.'' April 14 at 3 p.m. $7; children, $5; includes museum admission. South Fork Natural History Museum, 377 Bridgehampton/Sag Harbor Turnpike. (631) 537-9735.
Cold Spring Harbor Daniel Thomas Moran, Suffolk County poet laureate. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free; registration required. Cold Spring Harbor Library, 95 Harbor Road. (631) 692-6820.
Cutchogue Ann Marie Borghese, author of ''Great Tastes of Long Island.'' April 15 at 1 p.m. Free. Castello di Borghese Vineyard, County Road 48 and Alvah's Lane. (631) 734-5111.
Farmingdale Tony Barnstone, poet. Thursday at 11 a.m. Free. Ward Hall, 2350 Broadhollow Road, Farmingdale State College. (631) 420-2739.

Huntington Mel Stottlemyre, author of ''Pride and Pinstripes: The Yankees, Mets and Surviving Life's Challenges.'' Thursday at 8 p.m. Charles B. Rangel, author of ''And I Haven't Had a Bad Day Since.'' Friday at 8 p.m. Both free. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.

Huntington ''Old Time Baseball: Then and Now,'' lecture by Gary Monti, adviser for Bethpage Village's Old Time Baseball Program. April 15 at noon. $15; includes refreshments. David Conklin Farmhouse, 2 High Street. (631) 427-7045, Extension 401.

Jericho Green Living Seminars: ''Introduction to Organic Landscaping,'' lecture presented by Eric Pomisel of Gro-Kind Organics. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Half Hollow Hills Library, 510 Sweet Hollow Road. (516) 938-6152.
Oceanside ''The Craft of Poetry,'' workshop led by Barbara Novak, poet. Thursday at 2 p.m. Free. Oceanside Library, 30 Davison Avenue. (516) 766-2360.
Patchogue ''Urban Music in Urban Spaces: Hip-Hop in Chile,'' lecture presented by Patricio Hernández. Tuesday at 12:40 p.m. Free. O'Connor Hall, St. Joseph's College, Suffolk Campus. (631) 447-7434.

West Hills Marathon reading of Whitman's ''Leaves of Grass.'' April 15, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Donation: $3. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.
FOR CHILDREN
Cold Spring Harbor ''A Children's Craft.'' Create a ''Save the Whales'' banner. Ages 6 to 12. April 15 at 1 p.m. $7; members, $2.50; reservations required. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.
East Farmingdale ''Velveteen Rabbit,'' adapted from the story by Margery Williams. Through May 27. $8. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.

East Islip ''Beauty and the Beast,'' children's play followed by tea party. Saturdays, April 14 through May 5. $8; $20 for show and tea party. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.

Garden City ''Short Film Festivals for Families,'' family films by independent filmmakers. Ages 3 and up. Monday at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''Bumblebee Boogie!'' Learn two bee ''dances'' and create a craft. Ages 6 to 12. April 14 at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission, $2 for members. ''El Louie Show,'' presented by Louie Miranda. Ages 2 and up. April 14 and 15 at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''Magical Musical Art,'' explore the work of de Kooning and Duchamp and learn how music influenced their action paintings. Ages 6 to 12. April 15 at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission, $2 for members. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.
Kings Park ''Nature Scavenger Hunt.'' Ages 5 and up. April 14 at 2 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Nissequogue River State Park, St. Johnland Road. (631) 269-4927.
Lindenhurst ''Aladdin,'' children's theater followed by a tea party. Saturdays, April 14 through May 19. $8; $20 for show and tea party. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.
Oyster Bay ''Reptiles.'' Learn about reptiles and create a craft. Ages 4 to 10. April 15 at 1:30 p.m. $8; members, $5. Theodore Roosevelt Sanctuary and Audubon Center, 134 Cove Road. (516) 922-3200.
Patchogue ''Bam Percussion!'' Family performance with comedy and drumming. April 15 at 3 p.m. $9. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.
Riverhead ''Arbor Day.'' Count tree rings, identify local trees and make leaf rubbings. April 15, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. $2; children, $5. Long Island Science Center, 11 West Main Street. (631) 208-8000.

Smithtown ''World in a Bottle.'' Make a terrarium; bring two-liter bottle with screw top. All ages. April 15 at 1:30 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.

St. James Drop-in Arts Night: View the current photography exhibition and create a picture frame. Ages 7 to 12. Friday at 7 p.m. $5; reservations required. Mills Pond House Gallery, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Spring 2007 Exhibition,'' paintings by various artists. Through April 30. Hours: Saturdays, 1 to 5 p.m. Ratio Gallery, 10 Bell Street. (631) 286-4020.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

Huntington ''Bebe Identity,'' photographs by Richard Gardner. Through April 29. Reception: April 14, 7 to 9 p.m. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.
Southampton Works by Irene Zevon. Through April 30. Free. Hours: Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Bravura Art and Objects, 22 Nugent Street. (631) 259-2605.

Correction: April 12, 2007, Thursday A picture caption on the Calendar page in the Long Island section on Sunday carried incorrect details about a concert by the Brentano String Quartet, at the Sayville Middle School, this Saturday. Admission is $30; the concert is not free. Besides Beethoven and Mozart, the program will include the works of Bartok; it will not feature works by Horne. The caption also misstated the telephone number for information. The number is (631) 224-5420.
Correction: April 12, 2007, Thursday

A picture caption on the Calendar page in the Long Island section on Sunday carried incorrect details about a concert by the Brentano String Quartet, at the Sayville Middle School, this Saturday. Admission is $30; the concert is not free. Besides Beethoven and Mozart, the program will include the works of Bartok; it will not feature works by Horne. The caption also misstated the telephone number for information. The number is (631) 224-5420.
